title: The action property does not close the toast when clicking on the primary button.
body:
**Describe the bug**
The action property does not close the toast when clicking on the primary button. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create a toast with an action (could be as simple as a console log)
2. Trigger the toast and click on the action
4. See bug (the action will occur but the toast won't be dismissed)

**Example Code to Reproduce**
Here is an example of a toast with an action that I pulled straight from the docs:

```
toast('My action toast', {
  action: {
    label: 'Action',
    onClick: () => console.log('Action!'),
  },
});
```

**Expected behavior**
When you click on the primary button, it should run the action as well as close the toast. 

**Environment info**

<!--
  Please provide the version of the libraries below.
-->

| Library                      | Version |
| ---------------------------- | ------- |
| sonner-native                | ^0.16.2  |
| react-native                 | 0.76.3  |
| react-native-reanimated      | ~3.16.1  |
| react-native-gesture-handler | ~2.20.2  |

**Additional context**
Here is the root of my app as well:

```
    <Suspense fallback={<Loading />}>
      <SQLiteProvider
        databaseName="coshop"
        useSuspense
        options={{ enableChangeListener: true }}
      >
        <QueryClientProvider client={queryClient}>
          <NetworkProvider>
            <AuthProvider>
              <GestureHandlerRootView style={{ flex: 1 }}>
                <BottomSheetModalProvider>
                  <Toaster />
                  <InitialLayout />
                </BottomSheetModalProvider>
              </GestureHandlerRootView>
            </AuthProvider>
          </NetworkProvider>
        </QueryClientProvider>
      </SQLiteProvider>
    </Suspense>
```

title: I need forbidPress
body: Can you add a control so that the background cannot be clicked during toast?
author: YuGer26

comments.body: The background of the toast or the rest of your app?

For the background of the entire app, I hope that when toast.loading exists, other locations on the page cannot be clicked until toast.dismiss() is executed; I thought of a way and wrote a component nested in sonner-native, adding a method 'forbidPress' to control whether the background can be clicked when toast takes effect. By the way, I optimized the action according to my own preferences. The code is posted below

Since <Toaster /> is rendered using `FullWindowOverlay` from `react-native-screens` on iOS, you probably want to use that as well lower in your view hierarchy for your covering view. You might as well experiment with using `Modal` from `react-native`. 

This is definitely out of scope for `sonner-native` and something that should be handled in user-land.

When I add a custom icon to the toast component, it did not show up, but not adding an icon at all makes it show

**To Reproduce**
```js
import { CircleCheck } from "lucide-react-native";


export function successToast({
  title,

  duration = 4000,
}: SuccessToast) {

    className: "bg-green-500",
    style: { backgroundColor: "green" },
    description,
    duration,
    icon: <CircleCheck />, // this does not show
  });
```

The CircleCheck icon should show in the toast

title: lucide-react-native & react-native-svg
body:
Ideally, we'd want to have no unnecessary dependencies like react-native-svg. Using react-native-vector-icons is also bloating the lib so we wouldn't be better off with that. 

The only other option that I can think of is to ditch icons entirely in the lib and have them passed down as props, but I don't like that option much either. 

Any suggestions?
author: gunnartorfis

comments.body: @hyoban what is your thought on this?
react-native-svg is fine, as almost every project using svg icon uses it. For `lucide-react-native`, maybe we copy the icons we use to this package.
True. Let's keep this as is for now.
